27.84.text:
Hello, only one place remains
in the second round.

31.80.text:
It'll go to whichever team
wins tonight.

34.36.text:
Now, both of tonight's contestants
lost their first-round matches

37.88.text:
but did so with scores
creditable enough

40.04.text:
to earn them this final chance
to qualify.

43.04.text:
The team from
the University of Southampton

45.20.text:
took an early lead
in their first-round match

49.44.text:
who obliged them by digging
themselves into the minuses

52.12.text:
and looking quite happy there
by the halfway mark.

54.40.text:
Though, they lost the lead
and fell to regain it

57.24.text:
and were 30 points behind
at the gong.

59.52.text:
Still, it would have been much worse
without Southampton's knowledge

65.40.text:
and their familiarity
with the Horrible Histories books.

68.92.text:
With an average age of 26, let's
meet the Southampton team again.

75.08.text:
I'm from Swindon and I'm studying
for a Masters in history.

79.88.text:
I'm originally from Cardiff
and I'm reading chemistry.

83.64.text: Hello, my name is Tricia Goggin.

85.16.text:
I'm originally
from New Ross in Ireland

87.32.text:
and I'm doing a PhD
in biomedical engineering.

90.56.text:
Hi, I'm Roland Sadler, I'm from
London and I'm doing biology.

98.16.text:
The team from Queen Mary University
of London

100.80.text:
had a similar experience
to Southampton's

104.40.text:
with an early lead against
Nuffield College, Oxford

106.88.text:
dwindling down to a losing score
of 130 to 165 at the gong.

111.40.text:
They were strong on the events
of the noughties,

113.52.text:
the history of the Smithsonian
and the plays of Bertolt Brecht

116.64.text:
despite the fact that some of them
are pursuing areas of study

119.76.text:
that might be regarded
as somewhat niche.

122.52.text:
Let's remind ourselves of those as we
meet again the team from Queen Mary.

128.60.text:
I'm originally from Nottingham
and I'm studying for an MD

134.68.text:
I'm from Bishop's Stortford
in Hertfordshire

136.68.text:
and I'm a PhD student working on
the cultural history of the lapdog

141.84.text: Hi, my name is Verity Williams.

143.40.text:
I'm from Eastbourne
and I'm studying medicine.

147.44.text:
I'm from Formby near Liverpool
and I'm studying medical genetics.

155.52.text: Well, you all know the rules,

156.76.text: let's just get on with it.

include a person who stands firm,

163.68.text:
the solid mineral material
that forms the surface of the earth,

167.28.text:
the flesh of a dogfish,
cubed ice in a drink...

176.24.text:
Your bonuses, the first
set of bonuses, Southampton,

180.96.text:
"For as it is not one swallow or one
fine day that makes the spring,

184.80.text:
"so it is not one day or a short time
that makes a man blessed and happy."

189.96.text:
This statement appears
in the Nicomachean Ethics,

192.76.text: a work by which Greek philosopher?

199.24.text:
"True hope is swift and flies
with swallow's wings.

202.76.text:
"Kings it makes gods
and meaner creatures kings."

206.28.text:
Richmond says these words
on the eve of battle

217.68.text:
"And gathering swallows
twitter in the skies."

220.40.text:
These are the last lines
of an ode by John Keats.

235.64.text:
the following lines
in its introduction?

237.96.text:
"When I began to ransack the archives
of the National Academy of Music,

241.64.text:
"I was at once struck
by the surprising coincidences

247.60.text:
"and the most extraordinary
and fantastic tragedy

250.48.text:
"that ever excited the minds
of the Paris upper classes."

These bonuses, Southampton,

272.28.text:
Her estranged husband had

and unsuccessfully cited

were included
in the Matrimonial Causes Act

288.00.text:

302.20.text: I think it was in the 1850s.

of 1882

309.32.text:
ensured that married women
had the same rights

311.32.text:
over their property
as unmarried women.

314.36.text: Who was Prime Minister at the time?

324.72.text:
since ancient times

and which has featured several times

402.52.text: is located in the upper abdomen

with its head adjacent

and featuring characters

what was the last opera

For your picture starter,
